page.title: 11Lore and Legend
page.content: Ugglebarnby and Fylingdales Moors have played host to many legends. The most famous of these legends is the legend of "The Penny Hedge". The legend states that in the fifth year of the reign of Henry the Second, three noblemen were hunting a wild boar. The hounds chased the wounded boar into the place called The Hermitage where a hermit lived. The hermit looked after the boar but it eventually died. The noblemen were very annoyed with the hermit and set about him. The hermit sent for the Abbot and told him to forgive them. The Abbot set a penance on the men which was to build a hedge in Whitby at low tide on Ascension Day which had to withstand three tides. The hedge had to cost no more than one penny.
